item.title: "One hundred days after the police torture and murder of...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

"One hundred days after the police torture and murder of George Floyd, the resurgent Black Lives Matter movement continues!

Kops Keep Killing! Fascist vigilantes keep attacking us in the streets! The only thing that can stop either of them is the organized, mass, militant fightback of the working class and oppressed.

Let’s make some noise tonight to show our opposition to racism, fascism, and the police. Let’s show our violent opponents, whether in or out of uniform, that we ...will not be silenced. Quite the opposite, they will only make us louder!

Whose streets? Our streets! Whose land? Indigenous land!

No more pigs in our community! Off the pig!�
Nazi scum, off our streets!

Bring a pot and a wooden spoon, in the great noisemaking protest tradition used around the world. (Heck, bring a bag of soup too! 😂 For your family ofc.) Bring a sign, water, comfy shoes, and earplugs too!"

See More

SAT, SEP 5 AT 7:00 PM MDT

BLM-Antifa Noise Demo

Colorado State Capitol

· DenverCauses

item.title: Immigration is an LGBTQ Issue: Love Across Borders TUESDAYS...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

Immigration is an LGBTQ Issue: Love Across Borders
TUESDAYS @ 6:30pm • Sept. 8, 15*, 22 & 29

(This event is NOT being held at the Althea Center.)

...

ONLINE via Zoom to Facebook Live
• Sept. 15*: Only available online on this date.
• Recordings of the series will be posted on YouTube.
OR
ON-SITE (Raíces Brewing, 2060 West Colfax Ave.)
• In-person reservations REQUIRED & limited to first 50 people.

Drinks & Pizza at Raíces Brewing Company starting @ 5:30PM (Reservations required for Raíces)

Zoom Program and live streaming @ 6:30PM

Entertainment produced by Black Actors Guild @ 7:30-8:00PM

Registration: FREE 4-week series!
Please register in advance.
Raíces reservation and program Zoom information emailed with RSVP confirmation.
Immigration Equality shoulder bag for the first 100 registrants.

https://www.altheacenter.org/loveacrossborders

Mariposa at the Althea Center, in partnership with NY-based Immigration Equality and American Friends Service Committee Colorado, will present “Immigration is an LGBTQ Issue: Love Across Borders,” 4-week series of programs highlighting some of the traumatizing circumstances and critical needs of our LGBTQ sisters and brothers seeking asylum in the United States.

With simultaneous Spanish/English interpretation provided for Zoom participants, we will hear powerful and personal migration stories from current and recent LGBTQ asylum seekers. PFLAG Las Cruces, NM, will share their “real life” model of hosting asylum seekers, for which they won an award last year from the national PFLAG organization. We will hear from national and local leaders doing the day-to-day work of assisting and supporting these asylum seekers.

Registration: FREE 4-week series!
Please register in advance.
Raíces reservation and program Zoom information emailed with RSVP confirmation.
Immigration Equality shoulder bag for the first 100 registrants.

https://www.altheacenter.org/loveacrossborders

https://facebook.com/events/s/immigration-is-an-lgbtq-issue-/269755917346880/?ti=cl

See More

TUE, SEP 8 AT 6:30 PM MDT

Immigration is an LGBTQ Issue: Love Across Borders

Causes · 164 people

item.title: I need you all to keep sharing this young man's story!...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

I need you all to keep sharing this young man's story! Especially if you're from Montbello this happen in our own neighborhood.

The Denver DA Beth McCann decided not to charge Desmond Manning because "there a good self-defense case"

I call bullshit.

...

They are referring to the "Make my day act" or CRS 18-8-704 which states,

“…a person is justified in using physical force upon another person in order to defend himself or a third person from what he reasonably believes to be the use or imminent use of unlawful physical force by that other person, and he may use a degree of force which he reasonably believes to be necessary for that purpose.”

Deadly force is only lawful if

- you are in imminent danger of being killed or getting severely hurt,

- the assailant is committing a burglary

- or if the assailant is committing a kidnapping, robbery, sexual assault or a felony assault

Alexis was not committing a burglary or robbery, he was simply TRESPASSING in an EMPTY HOUSE.
When police arrived the teens scattered, jumping through fences.

Desmond Manning's wife remained inside with the police and Desmond says "I just kinda stood at the back door, ‘cause I knew – I had a feeling, if, if you guys came they was gonna come through our yard.”

He had a feeling they were going and here's the key word, THROUGH his yard.

HE UNDERSTOOD THEY WERE ONLY GOING TO RUN AWAY THROUGH HIS YARD, and he still thought it necessary to shoot five round at people who were running AWAY FROM HIM & TO THE FENCE.

Desmond Manning claims that Alexis and his friends were running straight towards him and his home....

Yet Alexis was shot IN THE BACK, FROM SEVERAL FEET AWAY!

PLEASE KEEP SHARING & DON'T LET STORY THIS DIE OUT.

The family is hurting and fighting to get justice.

#JusticeforAlexisMendezPerez

See MoreJustice for Alexis Mendez Perez

Shooting a 16 year old in the back as he runs away is NOT SELF DEFENSE. Join the family in demanding #justiceforalexis! Sign the petition. Call the DA. Honor him today. #sayhisname

NYPD Commissioner Dermot Shea said on Friday morning that police were still investigating whether a crime was committed.”

🧐🤔

The vehicle’s license plate matches that of another car frequently shared on social media by Hakim Gibson, a pro-NYPD activist who currently runs a “law enforcement support page.”

item.title: "Unlike other cities, Denver’s charter prohibits...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

"Unlike other cities, Denver’s charter prohibits bargaining over officers’ discipline, policing policies, and oversight — resulting in contracts that also shield abusive officers from firings and prosecution.

Unlike other city workers — who are not allowed to unionize, are forced to take furloughs, and face layoffs next year — Denver’s police union, the Denver Police Protective Association (PPA) and the Mayor agreed to give officers nearly 3% in raises and a 2-year contract, ...

Continue ReadingThe contract is still under lock and key but got a public hearing at city council.

denverite.com

The Denver police union is asking for an almost 3 percent pay raise in 2022, no bump in 2021

The contract is still under lock and key but got a public hearing at city council.The contract is still under lock and key but got a public hearing at city council.
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: "Over the last five fiscal years, 69 percent of the...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

"Over the last five fiscal years, 69 percent of the individuals detained at the Aurora Contract Detention Facility, which is run by private prison company GEO Group through a contract with Immigration and Customs Enforcement, have gone through court proceedings without a lawyer, according to the Vera Institute of Justice, which advocates for increased representation of immigrants in civil detention. While defendants in all criminal proceedings, whether citizens or not, are gu...aranteed a right to counsel, those detained by the federal government for immigration violations have no such right. And in extremely complicated immigration cases, legal representation can be key [...]

Since 2001, just 2 percent of those detained at the Aurora ICE facility who went to court without a lawyer had successful outcomes in their cases. Meanwhile, 28 percent of those detainees represented by legal counsel were victorious and able to stay in the United States.

"It is materially unfair — and, of course, what makes it even more unfair is that most of the people who are in proceedings are people who have been here for a very long time," says Siulc. "It’s not just removing somebody. It’s about the instability it’s causing their household and whole social network."

See MoreUnlike in criminal court, defendants have no right to counsel in immigration court proceedings.

westword.com

Colorado Advocates Pushing for Statewide Immigrant Legal Defense Fund

Unlike in criminal court, defendants have no right to counsel in immigration court proceedings.Unlike in criminal court, defendants have no right to counsel in immigration court proceedings.

item.title: At the same time that #ElijahMcClain was fighting for his life,...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

At the same time that #ElijahMcClain was fighting for his life, Elijah McKnight was being hospitalized for non consensual ketamine injection by law enforcement request, just miles away. From the article, describing body cam footage:

“After about six minutes, paramedics determine McKnight does not need hospital treatment.
But then one of the deputies asks, "You can't give him anything can you? Unless you go to the hospital, right?"
A paramedic responds, "We can give him ketami...ne. He'll be sleeping like a baby, but he'll have to go to the hospital."
McKnight objects, yelling: "Don't give me. Don't inject anything into my veins."

See MoreTwo men in Colorado were cuffed on the ground. Both were injected with tranquilizers against their will in police stops.

apple.news

Two strangers, with the same first name, and a terrifying story about ketamine in policing — CNN

item.title: “The Greek government has secretly expelled more than 1,000...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

“The Greek government has secretly expelled more than 1,000 refugees from Europe’s borders in recent months, sailing many of them to the edge of Greek territorial waters and then abandoning them in inflatable and sometimes overburdened life rafts. […]

‘It was very inhumane,’ said Najma al-Khatib, a 50-year-old Syrian teacher, who says masked Greek officials took her and 22 others, including two babies, under cover of darkness from a detention center on the island of Rhodes on July 26 and abandoned them in a rudderless, motorless life raft before they were rescued by the Turkish Coast Guard.

‘I left Syria for fear of bombing — but when this happened, I wished I’d died under a bomb,’ she told The Times.”

Many Greeks have grown frustrated as tens of thousands of asylum seekers languished on Greek islands. Now, evidence shows, a new conservative government has a new method of keeping them out.

nytimes.com

Taking Hard Line, Greece Turns Back Migrants by Abandoning Them at Sea

Many Greeks have grown frustrated as tens of thousands of asylum seekers languished on Greek islands. Now, evidence shows, a new conservative government has a new method of keeping them out.Many Greeks have grown frustrated as tens of thousands of asylum seekers languished on Greek islands. Now, evidence shows, a new conservative government has a new method of keeping them out.

item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: Last July, President Trump and administration officials announced to the public that Immigration and Customs Enforcement...
item.content:encoded:
Last July, President Trump and administration officials announced to the public that Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) was planning an operation to target thousands of immigrant families that have received final deportation orders- a carefully coordinated push that was to target on up to 10 "sanctuary" cities across the country.

Many of us in the Coalition to Close the Concentation Camps knew that it was time to take action against forces of fascism and evil- especially for our families impacted by this broken immigration system. On July 12, 2019, radicals and impacted families split from the milquetoast Lights for Liberty vigil being conducted at the Aurora ICE Processing Center. Rebels marched into the parking lot of GEO- where anticolonial speeches were given by indigenous youth and where the now infamous flag removal occurred.

Following the flag removal and international embarrassment, the Aurora Police Department began a Twitter manhunt offering a $4k reward to identify suspects from that evening; violent crimes typically only get a $1k reward and we knew this outrageously large reward was made because two anti police flags were flown that night. Cowards at APD wouldn't fire or prosecute the murderers of Elijah McClain the following month, yet APD had the time and resources to target non-violent protestors demanding justice for immigrants.

The woman featured in this powerful photo, Michelle, was eventually identified by non profit "allies" and served misdemeanor tampering charges; Michelle's case with Aurora dragged on for over a year. Today we have some good news: our hero was found NOT GUILTY by jury trial and walks free of all charges! Fuck APD!

Michelle- you are an inspiration and a true Chingona. With you, our city sent a message to the Department of Homeland Security. Your bravery, in addition to the life Willem Van Spronsen gave on July 13th 2019 by setting ICE's kidnapping vans in Tacoma ablaze, made ICE retreat on their planned nationwide mass arrests of immigrants.

#ChingaLaMigra #AbolishICE
Photo by @buffalo_heart_images
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: "All we are asking is to be transferred back to the Aurora facility. We are not asking for a release. They have the...
item.content:encoded:
"All we are asking is to be transferred back to the Aurora facility. We are not asking for a release. They have the authority to transfer us immediately if we want," says Jimmy Sodhi, a 45-year-old ICE detainee.

Sodhi is part of a group of eight ICE detainees who have been housed in the same dormitory at the Teller County Jail since being transferred there from the Aurora Contract Detention Facility one month ago. Sodhi and the other ICE detainees began the hunger strike on the morning of August 10 to protest what they allege are significantly worse conditions at Aurora GEO.

"As a Sikh, I'm not allowed to wear my Sikh bracelet, I'm not allowed to cover my head. If I have to pray, it's required for me to cover my head. I'm told to cover my head with a pillowcase or a towel," says Sodhi, who has been in ICE custody since March 2017 and is currently in the appeals process of his deportation case stemming from a fraud conviction for insider trading. "That is very demeaning, very disrespectful."

Sodhi notes that he was allowed to wear his turban at the Aurora detention facility, but has been told by staff at the Teller County Jail that he cannot retrieve his turban from his personal belongings. Same with prayer books, Sodhi adds, which he hasn't been able to obtain, being told by staff that "there's no chaplain here and we don't have those here."

Additionally, Sodhi contends that he and other ICE detainees at the Teller County Jail have been subjected to racial harassment perpetrated by non-ICE detainees staying in the same dormitory.

[...]

Adding to his angst, Sodhi contends that he and the other detainees don't even know why they're being housed in the Teller County Jail, which has an agreement with ICE to house immigrant detainees.

Via @denverwestword @conormichael28
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: Rest is radical and Camp #FreeThemAll has voted to lift up camp to allow our beloved community to rest and renew. We are...
item.content:encoded:
Rest is radical and Camp #FreeThemAll has voted to lift up camp to allow our beloved community to rest and renew. We are still in this fight for the long haul - aka until we #FreeThemAll.

Camp Free Them All has been a success in that we: saved lives, forced Aurora GEO to be one of two detention centers in the so-called United States to be offering COVID testing, forced a congressional hearing on COVID in ICE detection centers, stopped an illegal deporation, supported families with your love & money and built so much power together this summer! ✊💖

Despite these successes, we found out last week that nearly a third of the detainees are now being quarantined due to COVID and we fully intend to keep up the pressure on GEO, ICE & DHS.

Stay tuned for our next steps at Aurora GEO and if you want to help keep impacted families out of ICE custody, please donate directly to families!

Venmo: Sanctuary-4-All
Cashapp: $abolishicedenver

Tomorrow we ask that you please come get your belongings or contact us about storage. Any items not picked up will be given to unhoused neighbors and other struggles for liberation.

And please join us for a special Sunday vigil and Pablo's birthday celebration!

https://facebook.com/events/s/pablos-birthday-vigil/749228552534363/?ti=cl
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: The number of people quarantined at Aurora GEO has nearly doubled in one week. @repjasoncrow has been busy touring Air...
item.content:encoded:
The number of people quarantined at Aurora GEO has nearly doubled in one week. @repjasoncrow has been busy touring Air Force bases and isn't doing enough to address the threat of COVID 19 facing immigrants detained at the concentration camp in his district.

GEO and ICE cannot be trusted with the care of anyone in their custody and we demand that they #FreeThemAll
